alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 11:16PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cache and northeastern Box Elder Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clarkston to 7 miles southwest of Corinne. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Brigham City, Tremonton, Cache, Smithfield, Hyrum, Wellsville, Lewiston, Bear River City, Corinne, Clarkston, Trenton, Plymouth, Utah State University, Benson, Peter, Riverside, North Logan, Providence and Nibley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 365 and 400. Interstate 84 between mile markers 34 and 42. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 464. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
